gw.api.database

Interface IUpdateBuilder


  • public interface IUpdateBuilder
    Updates rows in the database for the given table.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int execute()
      Executes the query.
      ISimpleQueryBuilder getQuery() 
      IUpdateBuilder increment(IEntityPropertyInfo column, int increment)
      Increments the value of the given column by the given amount.
      IUpdateBuilder set(IEntityPropertyInfo column, java.lang.Object value)
      Changes the value in the given column to the given value
      IUpdateBuilder set(IEntityPropertyInfo columnInThisTable, Query subQuery, java.lang.Object selectColumn)
      Updates the value in the given column to the given value from the subselect
      IUpdateBuilder withDescription(java.lang.String descriptionForTheQuery)
      Sets a string describing the query.
      IUpdateBuilder withEvictFromGlobalCache(boolean shouldEvict)
      If the update is successful, the affected beans will be evicted from the global cache.
      IUpdateBuilder withLogSQL(boolean logSQL)
      Turns on or off SQL logging.
      IUpdateBuilder withParallelDml(boolean useParallelDml)
      Use parallel DML when executing this statement (Oracle only).

    • Method Detail

      • withParallelDml

        IUpdateBuilder withParallelDml(boolean useParallelDml)
        Use parallel DML when executing this statement (Oracle only). This behavior may be turned off globally in the configuration by setting the ora-parallel-dml attribute on the upgrade element to "disable". It may also be overridden with the parallel-dml attribute of the versiontrigger element.
        Parameters:
        useParallelDml - whether to use Oracle parallel DML when executing this statement.
        Returns:
        this

      • set

        IUpdateBuilder set(IEntityPropertyInfo column,
                 java.lang.Object value)
        Changes the value in the given column to the given value
        Parameters:
        column - column whose value to change
        value - new value for the column
        Returns:
        this

      • set

        IUpdateBuilder set(IEntityPropertyInfo columnInThisTable,
                 Query subQuery,
                 java.lang.Object selectColumn)
        Updates the value in the given column to the given value from the subselect
        Parameters:
        columnInThisTable - column whose value to change
        subQuery - Query to use in the subselect
        selectColumn - new value for the column
        Returns:
        this

      • increment

        IUpdateBuilder increment(IEntityPropertyInfo column,
                       int increment)
        Increments the value of the given column by the given amount. Column must be numeric
        Parameters:
        column - column whose value to change
        increment - amount by which to increment column. Can be negative.
        Returns:
        this

      • withEvictFromGlobalCache

        IUpdateBuilder withEvictFromGlobalCache(boolean shouldEvict)
        If the update is successful, the affected beans will be evicted from the global cache. Note that this can be expensive.
        Parameters:
        shouldEvict -
        Returns:
        this

      • withDescription

        IUpdateBuilder withDescription(java.lang.String descriptionForTheQuery)
        Sets a string describing the query. Useful for debugging performance issues.
        Returns:
        this

      • getQuery

        ISimpleQueryBuilder getQuery()
        Returns:
        the query portion of the operation

      • withLogSQL

        IUpdateBuilder withLogSQL(boolean logSQL)
        Turns on or off SQL logging. The query is logged to the PLLoggerCategory.SERVER_DATABASE log category at the info level
        Parameters:
        logSQL - true to log SQL, false to not
        Returns:
        the this ptr

      • execute

        int execute()
        Executes the query. If already in a transaction, the query executes in that transaction; otherwise a new transaction is created and committed when the method returns, or rolled back if the method throws an exception. The statement that is constructed will perform default behavior for the following fields (if present and not set):- BeanVersion (versionable beans only): incremented by 1 UpdateTime (editable beans only): current time UpdateUser (editable beans only): the current user
        Returns:
        the number of rows affected
